xxl.core.util.memory

Interface MemoryManageable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MemoryMonitorable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MemoryManageableQueue<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMemoryManageableQueue, DefaultMemoryManageableSA, MemoryManageableListQueue, MemoryManageableSA

    public interface MemoryManageable
extends MemoryMonitorable
    Models an object (e.g. an operator or a collection) that is able to manage limitations of its main memory usage. A memory manageable object registers itself with a memory manager by calling the register-Method of the memory manager, and the memory manager (respectively its strategy) assigns an amount of memory to this object by calling the assignMemSize-Method of this object.
    Since:
    1.1

      Assigns a special amount of memory to this object.
      int getAssignedMemSize()
      Returns the amount of memory, which is actually assigned to this object by the memory manager.
      int getObjectSize()
      Returns the estimated size of the objects which are stored in the memory of this memory monitorable object.

    • Field Detail

      • MAXIMUM

        static final int MAXIMUM
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getPreferredMemSize

        int getPreferredMemSize()
        Returns the amount of memory which is needed by this object for an acceptable performance. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.
        Returns:
        Returns the preferred amount of memory (in bytes).

      • getAssignedMemSize

        int getAssignedMemSize()
        Returns the amount of memory, which is actually assigned to this object by the memory manager.
        Returns:
        Returns the assigned amount of memory (in bytes).

      • assignMemSize

        void assignMemSize(int newMemSize)
        Assigns a special amount of memory to this object.
        Parameters:
        newMemSize - The amount of memory to be assigned to this object (in bytes).

      • getObjectSize

        int getObjectSize()
        Returns the estimated size of the objects which are stored in the memory of this memory monitorable object. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of a single object (in bytes).
